ICC Cricket World Cup, 10th Match, Pool B: Pakistan v West Indies at Christchurch, Feb 21, 2015
Scorecard | Commentary | Wickets | Partnership table | Player v player table | Over comparison | Career averages | Report | Article index (16) | Photo index (35) | Hawk-Eye | Wagon wheel | Manhattan | Worm | Run rate graph | Player v player graph | Partnership graph | Scoring shots graph | Wickets pie | Extras pie
ICC Cricket World Cup - 10th match, Pool B
Pakistan v West Indies
West Indies won by 150 runs
ODI no. 3608 | 2014/15 season
Played at Hagley Oval, Christchurch (neutral venue)
21 February 2015 (50-over match)
  West Indies innings (50 overs maximum) R M B 4s 6s SR
DR Smith c Haris Sohail b Sohail Khan 23 34 27 4 0 85.18
7.5 84.8 mph, gone! That's a lovely delivery, fourth-stump line and Smith pushes at it away from his body, edge carries through at a nice waist height to Haris at second slip. Caught Sohail bowled Sohail. 28/2
CH Gayle c Wahab Riaz b Mohammad Irfan 4 21 14 0 0 28.57
4.6 87.0 mph, this one's taken, and it's taken well. Gayle goes for the pull but it's too quick for him to control, and the top edge flies to long leg, where Wahab takes a well-judged catch, tumbling forward 17/1
DM Bravo retired hurt 49 115 78 3 0 62.82
31.2 from Wahab Riaz, length ball, angling in towards middle. Looks to play it into the on side and closes his bat face early, pops up towards backward point. Goes for the single and seems to pull a muscle just as he reaches the bowler's end. On comes the physio again, and they take the drinks break. 152/3
MN Samuels c sub (Yasir Shah) b Haris Sohail 38 69 52 4 0 73.07
24.1 50.0 mph, and he strikes first ball! Samuels comes down the track, I think he may have wanted to hit this straighter, maybe over mid-on. Maybe he didn't quite get to the pitch of it, and he ends up slicing it straight down long-off's throat 103/3
D Ramdin† c sub (Yasir Shah) b Haris Sohail 51 65 43 7 0 118.60
39.5 48.5 mph, goes for the big hit over the on side but doesn't get to the pitch and skews it high in the air, drops down into long-off's hands. Yasir takes another catch 194/4
LMP Simmons run out (Sohail Khan/†Umar Akmal) 50 91 46 4 2 108.69
49.6 Wahab Riaz to Russell, there's the yorker as Russell backs away and he inside-edges that swipe down towards the fine leg boundary. Simmons calls for the third and dives into the crease, the throw and Akmal's glovework beat him by a few inches 310/6
DJG Sammy c Shahid Afridi b Wahab Riaz 30 37 28 3 1 107.14
47.1 84.6 mph, back of a length on off stump and Shahid Afridi takes a catch. It was angled in, and it cramped Sammy, who tried to carve it over backward point but couldn't time it well enough to clear the fielder. Simple catch in the end 259/5
AD Russell not out 42 17 13 3 4 323.07
Extras (b 2, lb 6, w 14, nb 1) 23

0.6 88.8 mph, got him! That's brilliant from Taylor. Went wide of the crease, angled it in towards off stump, very full. Younis' front foot was stuck and he pushed at the ball and nicked it through to the keeper, walking into the shot 1/2
Haris Sohail c sub (JL Carter) b Taylor 0 8 6 0 0 0.00
2.6 80.4 mph, Taylor has three! Three ducks! It's short and angling into the body again, no room to cut, but he goes after it with an angled bat and scoops it straight to backward point, who takes it after a juggle 1/3
Misbah-ul-Haq* c Gayle b Russell 7 34 21 1 0 33.33
10.3 83.9 mph, taken! That was short and wide and Misbah flashed hard at it, thick edge flew to the left of first slip but Gayle moved quickly to take an excellent catch with both hands 25/5

25.3 77.9 mph, Gone. It's a low full-toss on off stump and Maqsood looked to hit it down the ground, went up off the bottom of his bat and Benn did brilliantly to catch that, diving full-length to his left from mid-on 105/6
Umar Akmal† c Smith b Russell 59 88 71 5 1 83.09
31.4 84.0 mph, they moved a fielder back onto the midwicket boundary after that previous shot, and Russell bowled a straighter line. Went for the same shot, hit it well but hit it much squarer than the previous one, and it went straight down the throat of the fielder 139/7
Shahid Afridi c Holder b Benn 28 50 26 4 0 107.69
36.2 65.4 mph, and he's gone. Full-toss, and he swipes it straight into the hands of short midwicket. Nice low catch from Holder 157/9
Wahab Riaz c †Ramdin b Russell 3 17 13 0 0 23.07
35.3 84.0 mph, whataball! That cut back in sharply from outside off and took the inside edge of his defensively-thrust bat, onto thigh pad and it looped towards the keeper, who dived forward and claimed a low catch. They've gone up to the third umpire now. Yup, straight into the gloves. Well taken, that. 155/8
Sohail Khan c †Ramdin b Benn 1 12 8 0 0 12.50
38.6 53.4 mph, now he connects with the slog sweep but only with the edge of his bat. Soars 20 storeys high and it's Ramdin who settles under it in the end 160/10
Mohammad Irfan not out 2 8 11 0 0 18.18

Match details

Toss - Pakistan, who chose to field
Points - West Indies 2, Pakistan 0
Player of the match - AD Russell (West Indies)
Umpires - M Erasmus (South Africa) and NJ Llong (England)
TV umpire - S Ravi (India)
Match referee - DC Boon (Australia)
Reserve umpire - SD Fry (Australia)
